publicationStmt.publisher: Uppsala University, Department of linguistics and philology

msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Numbers 1
ab.l:
And the Lord spoke
to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tent of meeting,
on the first day of the second month, in the second
year after they had come out from the land of Egypt, saying,

‘Take the sum of the heads of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families,
by the house of their fathers, with the number of their names, every male
by their heads.

From twenty years old and upward, all who go out
to war in Israel: you and Aaron shall number them by their armies.

And a man of each tribe shall be with you,
a man being the superior of the house of his fathers.

And these are
the names of the men that shall stand with you: of the tribe
of Reuben: Elizur, son of Shedeur.

Of the tribe
of Simeon: Shelumiel, son of Zurishaddai.
Of the tribe of Judah: Nahshon, son of Amminadab.
Of the tribe of Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar.
Of the tribe of Zebulun: Eliab, son of Helon.
Of the tribe of Benjamin: Abidan, son of Gideoni.
Of the tribe of Dan: Ahiezer, son of Ammishaddai.

Of the tribe
of Asher: Pagiel, son of Ocran.

Of the tribe of
Gad: Eliasaph, son of Deuel.

Of the tribe Naphtali:
Ahira, son of Enan.’

These were the renowned
of the congregation, princes of the tribes of their fathers. They are the superiors
of thousands in Israel.

And Moses and Aaron took
these men who had been designated by name.

And they assembled all the congregation on the first day
of the second month, and they were proved by their families, by the house
of their fathers, with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, by their heads,

As the Lord commanded Moses. And he numbered them
in the wilderness of Sinai.

And the sons of Reuben,
Israel’s firstborn, their children by their families,
by the house of their fathers, with the number of names, by their heads, every male
from twenty years old and upward, all who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe of Reuben, were forty-six thousand and five
hundred.

Of the sons of Simeon, their children
by their families, by the house of their fathers, those that were numbered of them, with the number of names,
by their heads, every male from twenty years old and upward, all
who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe
of Simeon, were fifty-nine thousand and three hundred.

Of the sons of Gad, their children by their families, by the house of their fathers,
with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all
who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe
of Gad, were forty-five thousand and six hundred and fifty.

Of the sons
of Judah, their children by their families, by the house
of their fathers, with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all
who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe
of Judah, were seventy-four thousand and six hundred.

Of the sons of Issachar, their children by their families,
by the house of their fathers, with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward,
all who go out to war:

Those that were numbered
of them, of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty-four thousand and four
hundred.

Of the sons of Zebulun, their children by their families,
by the house of their fathers, with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward,
all who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them,
of the tribe of Zebulun, were fifty-seven thousand and four hundred.

Of the sons of Joseph, of the sons of Ephraim, their children
by their families, by the house of their fathers, with the number of names, from twenty
years old and upward, all who go out to war:

Those that were numbered
of them, of the tribe of Ephraim, were forty thousand and five hundred.

Of the sons of Manasseh, their children by their families, by the house
of their fathers, with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all
who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe
of Manasseh, were thirty-two thousand and two hundred.

Of the sons
of Benjamin, their children by their families, by the house of their fathers,
with the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all
who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe of Benjamin,
were thirty-five thousand and four hundred.

Of the sons of Dan,
their children by their families, by the house of their fathers, with the number
of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who go out to war:

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe of Dan, were sixty-
-two thousand and seven hundred.

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe of Asher, were forty-one
thousand and five hundred.

Those that were numbered of them, of the tribe of Naphtali, were fifty-three thousand and four
hundred.

These are those that were numbered, that Moses and Aaron
and the princes of Israel numbered; twelve men, each one
was by the house of his fathers.

And all those that were numbered
of the sons of Israel, by the house of their fathers, from twenty years old
and upward, all who go out to war in Israel:

And
all they that were numbered were six times a hundred thousand and three thousand
and five hundred and fifty.

But the Levites after the tribe of
their fathers were not numbered among them.

And
the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Only the tribe
of Levi you shall not number, and you shall not take the sum of their heads among
the sons of Israel.

But you shall appoint the
Levites over the tabernacle of law, and over all its vessels,
and over all things that belong to it. They shall bear
the tabernacle and all its vessels, and they
shall serve it, and they shall camp around the tabernacle.

And when the tabernacle travels,
the Levites shall take it down, and when the tabernacle camps,
the Levites shall set it up. And the stranger who comes near, other than them,
shall be put to death.

And the sons of Israel shall dwell,
every man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard,
by their armies.

And the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle
of law, so there will be no anger on the congregation
of the children of Israel, and the Levites shall keep the
charge of the tabernacle of law.’

And
the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord commanded Moses.
They did so.
